alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Sierra Madre Range; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 3:21PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Carbon County through 415 PM MDT... At 321 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Baggs, or 38 miles southeast of Wamsutter, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Saratoga, Encampment, Baggs, Dixon, Grand Encampment, Battle Lake, Jack Creek Campground, Haskins Creek Campground, Savery, Lost Creek Campground, Little Sandstone Creek Campground, Hog Park Campground, Bottle Creek Campground, Battle Creek Campground, Hog Park Reservoir and Riverside. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Sierra Madre Range; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
